name: Biology Diagram Templates
description: Pre-built diagram templates for HSC Biology

templates.name: Animal Cell (Blank)
templates.description: Blank animal cell diagram for labeling activities

image.alt: Diagram of an animal cell showing organelles

templates.name: Plant Cell (Blank)
templates.description: Blank plant cell diagram for labeling activities

image.alt: Diagram of a plant cell showing organelles
Diagram of a prokaryotic bacterial cell

templates.name: Phospholipid Bilayer
templates.description: Cell membrane cross-section showing fluid mosaic model

image.alt: Cross-section of cell membrane showing phospholipid bilayer

hotspots.title: Hydrophilic Heads
hotspots.content: The phosphate heads face outward toward the water, making them hydrophilic (water-loving).

hotspots.title: Hydrophobic Tails
hotspots.content: The fatty acid tails face inward, away from water, making them hydrophobic (water-fearing).

hotspots.title: Integral Protein
hotspots.content: Span the entire membrane, often functioning as channels or transporters.

hotspots.title: Peripheral Protein
hotspots.content: Attached to the surface of the membrane, often involved in cell signaling.

hotspots.title: Cholesterol
hotspots.content: Helps maintain membrane fluidity and stability.

templates.name: DNA Double Helix
templates.description: DNA structure with base pairs labeled

image.alt: DNA double helix showing base pairing

templates.name: Chromosome Structure
templates.description: Chromosome showing sister chromatids and centromere

hotspots.title: Centromere
hotspots.content: The constricted region where sister chromatids are joined.

hotspots.title: Sister Chromatid
hotspots.content: One of two identical copies of a chromosome formed during DNA replication.

hotspots.title: Telomere
hotspots.content: Protective caps at the ends of chromosomes.

hotspots.title: Short Arm (p)
hotspots.content: The shorter arm of the chromosome.

hotspots.title: Long Arm (q)
hotspots.content: The longer arm of the chromosome.

templates.name: Mitosis Stages
templates.description: Six panels showing stages of mitosis

image.alt: Stages of mitosis: prophase, metaphase, anaphase, telophase

hotspots.title: Prophase
hotspots.content: Chromosomes condense, nuclear envelope breaks down, spindle fibers form.

hotspots.title: Metaphase
hotspots.content: Chromosomes line up at the metaphase plate, spindle fibers attach to centromeres.

hotspots.title: Anaphase
hotspots.content: Sister chromatids separate and are pulled to opposite poles.

hotspots.title: Telophase
hotspots.content: Nuclear envelopes reform, chromosomes decondense, cytokinesis begins.

templates.name: Enzyme-Substrate Complex
templates.description: Lock and key model of enzyme action

hotspots.title: Enzyme
hotspots.content: A biological catalyst that speeds up chemical reactions without being consumed.

hotspots.title: Active Site
hotspots.content: The specific region where the substrate binds to the enzyme.

hotspots.title: Substrate
hotspots.content: The molecule that binds to the enzyme's active site.

hotspots.title: Products
hotspots.content: The molecules produced after the enzyme catalyzes the reaction.

image.alt: Diagram showing transcription in nucleus and translation at ribosome

hotspots.title: Transcription
hotspots.content: DNA is transcribed into mRNA in the nucleus by RNA polymerase.

hotspots.title: mRNA Processing
hotspots.content: Introns are removed and a 5' cap and poly-A tail are added.

hotspots.title: Ribosome
hotspots.content: The site of protein synthesis where translation occurs.

hotspots.title: tRNA
hotspots.content: Transfer RNA brings amino acids to the ribosome matching the mRNA codon.

hotspots.title: Polypeptide Chain
hotspots.content: Growing chain of amino acids that will become a protein.

hotspots.title: DNA Template
hotspots.content: One strand of DNA serves as the template for mRNA synthesis.

templates.name: Punnett Square Template
templates.description: Blank Punnett square for inheritance problems

image.alt: Blank Punnett square for genetic crosses

hotspots.title: Male (Unaffected)
hotspots.content: Square represents male. Empty = unaffected by trait.

hotspots.title: Female (Unaffected)
hotspots.content: Circle represents female. Empty = unaffected by trait.

hotspots.title: Affected Individual
hotspots.content: Filled shape indicates individual expresses the trait.

hotspots.title: Carrier
hotspots.content: Half-filled indicates carrier (heterozygous for recessive trait).
